title: (x) SR Linen Collection New Catalogue serif and sans - Centaur, Frutiger Cond {Nick Job, Yves}
content:
Hi there,

Firstly, as I’m new to this forum, greetings to you all from Estonia!

I’m desperately trying to identify a couple of fonts here.. which brings me to you :P

this one:  
 [http://www.householdtextiles.com/cmpts/general/title.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133950/http:/www.householdtextiles.com/cmpts/general/title.gif)

and this one:  
 [http://www.householdtextiles.com/cmpts/general/newcat\_title.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133950/http:/www.householdtextiles.com/cmpts/general/newcat_title.gif)

Any guesses would be much appreciated.

Also, I’d be really thankful if anybody could suggest a lookalike for Palace Script by Monotype.

Cheers!
author: wkduk

comments.content: Try [Legacy Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133950/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=legacy+serif&q=Go) and [Myriad](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133950/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=myriad&q=Go) (it doesn’t look like the condensed version more like manually squooshed). And why don’t you just take [Palace Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133950/http:/www.identifont.com/find?similar=palace+script&q=Go)?

Thanks, Legacy Serif will do..  
I too suspected the second one to be Myriad Condensed / squashed.. just wanted to be sure :)  
Palace Script is unfortunately out-of-budget (sorry, forgot to mention I’m looking for a free lookalike) as it’s a personal project.

Thanks again for the quick response!
Actually, the second one is not Myriad but SG Today Sans Serif SB Light.. Once again - out of budget :(

This [SG Today Sans Serif SB Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20070320133950/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=424934)? Nope. It isn’t. The only thing which both faces have in common is that they are sanbs serif.
Isn’t it a light condensed Frutiger?
This is Centaur or something _really_ close and Frutiger Condensed indeed.
